bugs.title: CVE-2013-2221 CVE-2013-2222 CVE-2013-2223 libzrtpcpp various flaws [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2013-2221 CVE-2013-2222 CVE-2013-2223 libzrtpcpp various flaws [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2013-2221 libzrtpcpp: Heap-based buffer overflow when processing overly-large ZRTP packets

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the way libzrtpcpp, a ZRTP support library for the GNU ccRTP stack, processed certain ZRTP packets (overly-large ZRTP packets of several types). A remote attacker could provide a specially-crafted ZRTP packet that, when processed in an application linked against libzrtpcpp would lead to that application crash or, potentially, arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the user running that application.

References:
[1] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/06/29/1
[2] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/06/30/2
[3] http://blog.azimuthsecurity.com/2013/06/attacking-crypto-phones-weaknesses-in.html

Relevant upstream patch:
[4] https://github.com/wernerd/ZRTPCPP/commit/c8617100f359b217a974938c5539a1dd8a120b0e

This issue affects the versions of the libzrtpcpp package, as shipped with Fedora release of 17 and 18. Please schedule an update.

--

This issue affects the versions of the libzrtpcpp package, as shipped with Fedora EPEL-5 and Fedora EPEL-6. Please schedule an update.

Created libzrtpcpp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 980904]

Created libzrtpcpp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 980905]
libzrtpcpp-2.3.4-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2013-2222 libzrtpcpp: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows when processing certain ZRTP Hello packets

long_desc.thetext:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows were found in the way libzrtpcpp, a ZRTP support library for the GNU ccRTP stack, processed certain ZRTP Hello packets (ZRTP Hello packets with an overly-large value in certain fields, including the count of public keys). A remote attacker could provide a specially-crafted ZRTP packet that, when processed in an application linked against libzrtpcpp would lead to that application crash. 

References:
[1] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/06/29/1
[2] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/06/30/2
[3] http://blog.azimuthsecurity.com/2013/06/attacking-crypto-phones-weaknesses-in.html

Relevant upstream patch:
[4] https://github.com/wernerd/ZRTPCPP/commit/c8617100f359b217a974938c5539a1dd8a120b0e

This issue affects the versions of the libzrtpcpp package, as shipped with Fedora release of 17 and 18. Please schedule an update.

--

This issue did NOT affect the versions of the libzrtpcpp package, as shipped with Fedora EPEL-5 and Fedora EPEL-6.

Created libzrtpcpp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 980904]
libzrtpcpp-2.3.4-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2013-2223 libzrtpcpp: Multiple information (heap memory content) exposure flaws while processing truncated ZRTP Ping packets

long_desc.thetext:
Multiple information (heap memory content) exposure flaws were found in the way libzrtpcpp, a ZRTP support library for the GNU ccRTP stack, processed truncated ZRTP Ping packets. A remote attacker could provide a specially-crafted ZRTP Ping packet that, when processed in an application linked against libzrtpcpp would potentially reveal sensitive information stored on the heap.

References:
[1] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/06/29/1
[2] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/06/30/2
[3] http://blog.azimuthsecurity.com/2013/06/attacking-crypto-phones-weaknesses-in.html

Relevant upstream patch:
[4] https://github.com/wernerd/ZRTPCPP/commit/c8617100f359b217a974938c5539a1dd8a120b0e

This issue affects the versions of the libzrtpcpp package, as shipped with Fedora release of 17 and 18. Please schedule an update.

--

This issue did NOT affect the versions of the libzrtpcpp package, as shipped with Fedora EPEL-5 and Fedora EPEL-6.

libzrtpcpp-2.3.4-1.fc19 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 19.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/libzrtpcpp-2.3.4-1.fc19

I'm still investigating how best to update Fedora 17/18... (19 and rawhide can just simply be updated to the new upstream version, not sure yet if that will work for older releases or rebuilds/backporting is needed).

Package libzrtpcpp-2.3.4-1.fc19:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora 19 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing libzrtpcpp-2.3.4-1.fc19'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2013-12479/libzrtpcpp-2.3.4-1.fc19
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
